pButton.Name: Author
pButton.popInfo: The author of the book is King James VI of Scotland.

pButton.Name: Background
pButton.popInfo: King James VI was king of Scotland in 1598. Since Queen Elizabeth I, a cousin of James, died without an heir, James also became King James I of England in 1603.

pButton.Name: Place
pButton.popInfo: The book was printed in Edinburgh (the capital of Scotland).

pButton.Name: Publisher
pButton.popInfo: The book was published by the king's printer, a printer who would have only printed documents approved by the king or his advisors.

pButton.Name: Type
pButton.popInfo: Since this is a title page, you can see that the document is a book.

pButton.Name: Subject
pButton.popInfo: The subject of the book is the relationship between a king and the people that he rules.

pButton.Name: Audience
pButton.popInfo: The book was written for an educated audience.
